class FileManager.FileManager(directory)[source]¶

Used as a middleman between GUIManager and the file storage system. Sets the home directory, finds files to read from and write to, fetches content of specified files in the home directory.

delete(filename)[source]¶

Deletes the filename given to it in directory

Parameters:filename (str) – The name of file in the home directory which has to be removed
fetchDirectory()[source]¶

Used to get the home directory name / path

fetchFrom(filename)[source]¶

Used to get content from the specified file in the home directory

Parameters:filename (str) – The file that content has to be fetched from
makeFile(articleName)[source]¶

Used to create a new file with name articleName

Parameters:articleName (str) – the name of the file that has to be created
saveTo(filename, content)[source]¶

Used to save content to the specified file in the home directory

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The name of file in the home directory that content has to saved to
  • content (str) – The markdown text that has to be saved to the file
setDirectory(directory)[source]¶

Used to set the home directory

Parameters:directory (str) – this is set as the home directory
class IDS.IDS(val: str, viewer, type_: str = 'leaf', children=[], **kwargs)[source]¶

Internal Data Structure to act as a Bridge between md file and Tkinter object

click(link)[source]¶

Callback function to handle links

Parameters:link (str) – The name of the destination article
getFrame(text=None, enum=-1)[source]¶

Converts the subtree rooted at self to corresponding tk.Text object

Parameters:
  • text (tk.Text, optional) – The tk.Text object to render the subtree. Defaults to None.
  • enum (int, optional) – to maintain the tag attribute currospinding to the current node. Defaults to -1.
Returns:

the final tk.text object
Return type:

(tk.text, optional)

Parser for md to IDS.

getFrame(text)[source]¶

Returns the rendered tk.Text object corresponding to the md parsed.

Parameters:text (tk.Text) – tk.Text object to dump all the formatted text into
Returns:Rendered tk.Text object, ready to be packed

Parameters:type (str) – denotes the regex type wanted
Returns:returns the regex pattern object
Return type:re.pattern
isHeading(md, params)[source]¶

Checks if current line is heading and parses it further

Parameters:
  • md (str) – the partial markdown file
  • params (dict) – to pass the style params.
isLink(md, params)[source]¶

Checks if current line is link and parses it further

Parameters:
  • md (str) – the partial markdown file
  • params (dict) – to pass the style params.
isList(md, params={})[source]¶

Checks if current line is list and parses it further

Parameters:
  • md (str) – the partial markdown file
  • params (dict, optional) – to pass the style params. Defaults to {}.
isStyle(md, params)[source]¶

Checks if current line is bold or italics and parses it further

Parameters:
  • md (str) – the partial markdown file
  • params (dict) – to pass the style params.
isText(md, params)[source]¶

Checks if current line is text and parses it further

  • md (str) – the partial markdown file
  • params (dict) – to pass the style params.

class OpeningPage.OpeningPage(fileManager)[source]¶

Used to create the opening page for the application that lists the files in the home directory

generate()[source]¶

Used to update the opening page with the list of files in the home directory

class Surfer.Surfer[source]¶

Used to maintain the pages that have been visited in a stack to facilitate the “back” button

back()[source]¶

Returns to the previously visited page. Pops the topmost page in the stack if any and returns the subsequent topmost page

clear()[source]¶

Clears history of pages visited by the viewer

currentTop()[source]¶

Used to find the last visited page (topmost page in the stack). Returns the home page if the stack is empty

push(x)[source]¶

Used to add a page to the stack. Called when a new page is opened.

Parameters:x (str) – Refers to the filename / page that has been visited and is to be pushed to the stack
class Toolbar.Toolbar(parent, guimanager)[source]¶

Used to create a Toolbar Frame object which contains widgets to navigate through the application,create new pages, edit and view existing pages

changeMode(newMode)[source]¶

Used to change the widgets displayed on Toolbar depending on mode. Called by GUIManager

Parameters:newMode (int) – Specifies the mode to be switched to - {0 : Home mode, 1 : View mode, 2 : Edit mode}
newPage(frm)[source]¶

Used to create a new Page. Called when “New Page” button is clicked. Fetches new page name from entry widget and call newPage() from GUIManager

Parameters:frm (tk.Frame) – Specifies the mode in which the “New Page” button has been clicked {frm_home : Home mode, frm_view : View mode}
